page.title: 15FARMING IN BURTON (1)
page.content: Brompton Park is one of the most important farms in our area. It is a {240 acres}mixed farm and the{main crop is{early potatoes.}The potatoes are planted and harvested by machine which is a great advantage for faster work - two men can plant{70 acres}a day. When the potatoes are harvested, they are sold in the{Midlands, {Liverpool}and{Manchester. Other vegetables grown are{cabbages, {swedes and cauliflowers,}which are sold for Local Trade. The potatoes and other vegetables are irrigated by sprinklers from four irrigation reservoirs, constructed on the farm, each holding{half a million}gallons. {Barley}is grown on 40 acres of land, to feed animals. Some barley is used on the farm but most is sold. The straw is not burnt, as on some farms, but it is used for bedding calves.
